review: This is a must have item. If you don't believe me, come to my house, remove the one in my husband's TV and wait 5 minutes until the "OMG WHAT IS WRONG WITH MY CASTER THING" starts.... you'll be giving it back before you know it, because he needs it to live. And this is a man who needs very little, in fact, his list of needs goes as follows:Food. Fluids. A tv, his phone, and this thing. Sure, he LIKES other things, but does he need them? Nope. Does he need this? Yes.... yes he does. I learned this last night when I had removed the Chromecast to watch LoTR downstairs, casting from my Galaxy s4 to a Samsung Smart TV that doesnt have Google Play (where I happen to own LoTR movies). My husband had been napping, so I figured he wouldn't even notice. Boy was I wrong. Right at "We must join with Him, Gandalf. We must join.... " I heard "OMG MY CASTER IS GONE!!" There might have been some adult male crying. I can't be sure. Regardless- I'm ordering another one. Because life can't be lived without this CASTER. Evidently.
author: Random Mom

review: I've got it plugged into the back of my Yamaha stereo receiver and use it to link my HDTV with my Nexus 7 2013.I watch Netflix on the tablet or game while I'm doing video editing on my desktop PC.I used it to play Anodyne and Broken Sword 1 on my tablet, worked okay, but would crash sometimes.The good:-Streams Netflix fairly well-You can mirror a Nexus 7 2013 OK with itThe bad:-No support for Amazon instant viewing (that's more Amazon's fault than Google due to the lack of an Amazon android app)-Noticeable lag on Chromecast mirror feature-Prone to crashing sometimes using the mirror feature
